pullRequest.title: Add beekeeper
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changes proposed in this pull request:


add Beekeeper colonist


 mechanics (harvesting/breeding)


 hut recipe


 hut block model & texture


 scepter texture


 translations


 schematics (beekeeper hut has no special requirement)


Please review

@@ -533,7 +533,12 @@

nodes.bodyText: I don't think the worker needs any recipes
Should probably be pass and not fail.
Might be easier to save them directly in the building each time already.

commit.message:
add changes requested by Raycoms

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

fix merge conflict for class ModBlocks

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

remove test schematics

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

fix blockHutArchery being used twice in getHuts

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/beekeeper

nodes.bodyText:
Dexterity -> primary
Adaptability -> Secondary
Were planned for this worker
That is quite the creative way to make a tag based request. Although I'm unsure we shouldn't create just a TagBased request type new instead of doing it the hacky way.
I don't like the code style of this. We should have a setter for this on the building instead of getting a mutable list and add them by reference.
Possibly, when there are a bunch of glass bottles and flowers in the inventory they shouldn't request
Should probably set an interaction here, if they can't find bees within a time they gotta tell the player about this.

commit.message:
continue adding requested changes

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

fix errors that resulted from upstream changes

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

add proxy methods for adding/removing hives/nests to/from the beekeeper

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>
Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/beekeeper

Div text (#5175)

Some minor fixes
Add full diversity textures to minecolonies entities

Feature/recipe tags (#5058)

Introduces a system for adding and excluding recipes based on datapack tags

Schematics115 (#5189)

Schematic Deco Fixes

Removes fulfill and cancel from clipboard detail view (#5180)

Removes fulfill from clipboard detail view

Improve spawner in raids, improve ticks (#5199)

Tracks spawner position in raid event and regularly checks them
Also now uses the O(1) methods of racks better for the minimum stock ticks.

Add Stonebrick slabs and stairs to the list of path blocks. (#5219)

Add Stone Brick slabs and stairs to the list of path blocks.
This makes them prefer walking on them, and get a speed boost.

add a Tag based request (#5185)

this PR adds a Tag based request as proposed by @Raycoms in #5127

implement beekeeper ai

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

transition to tag requests

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

implement skill based features

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

add EntityAIWorkBeekeeper jdoc

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/version/1.15' into feature/beekeeper

nodes.bodyText: you should be able to simplify this one here now.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1505,6 +1507,39 @@ public boolean checkIfRequestForItemExistOrCreateAsynch(@NotNull final ItemStack
         return false;
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Check if a tag has been requested already or is in the inventory. If not in the inventory and not requested already, create request
+     *
+     * @param tag the requested tag.
+     * @return true if in the inventory, else false.
+     */
+    public boolean checkIfRequestForTagExistOrCreateAsynch(@NotNull final Tag<Item> tag, final int count)

nodes.bodyText: You can here filter it by TagRequest instead of Deliverable already, that's what I meant

commit.message:
implement changes requested by @Raycoms

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

add interaction if the beekeeper has no bees as suggested by @Raycoms

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: simplify this to a getHives().isEmpty() on the building, that way you don't use expensive area checks or accidentally load chunks. Let the AI do the checking
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -177,6 +180,18 @@ public static void init()
         InteractionValidatorRegistry.registerStandardPredicate(new TranslationTextComponent(BAKER_HAS_NO_FURNACES_MESSAGE),
           citizen -> citizen.getWorkBuilding() instanceof BuildingBaker && ((BuildingBaker) citizen.getWorkBuilding()).getFurnaces().isEmpty());
 
+        InteractionValidatorRegistry.registerStandardPredicate(new TranslationTextComponent(NO_BEES),
+          citizen -> citizen.getWorkBuilding() instanceof BuildingBeekeeper &&
+                       EntityAIWorkBeekeeper.searchForAnimals(citizen.getColony().getWorld(), (BuildingBeekeeper) citizen.getWorkBuilding()).isEmpty() &&

commit.message:
split interaction for the beekeeper into has no bees and has no hives

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

add jdoc

Signed-off-by: Minecraftschurli <minecraftschurli@gmail.com>

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/version/1.15' into feature/beekeeper
